intro: Lathyrus allardii, commonly known as the white-flowered grass vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
